Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory126.png'}
{3: 'Engine "Asslam" is moving smoothly as usual.'}
{3: 'Inside the first carriage, also known as the royal carriage.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: '...Emergency repair of the 11 functional carriages is complete. Train operation is back to normal. All damage is within the expected level.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'A scan of the remains of Rail Heterozygote has been done. We found a higher than expected Punishing reaction level, but no trace of He-4.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Increase the demand for He-4 in our proposed contract with Babylonia.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'Understood.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Is Sophia "guarding" the goods?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: "Yes. She's with the real one.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Holding a scale in her hand, the leader of Akdilek pauses a while before she speaks again.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'A merchant seeks not a fair deal but maximum profit.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: "The credo for merchants. That's what you have always taught Sophia.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'I also taught her to be honest in trade.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'Yes. All I can say is, you have always been right.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'All that business talk... You know how boring it is, Aston.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: "So you reward sincerity with sincerity and repay trickery with trickery. Everything's under your control, at least before the real trade.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: '"Pick the fine goods and get rid of the bad ones." This is the order you have given.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'This "trade" has completely separated those aristocrats behind Ashlar from the rest.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'They are probably hiding in one of the carriages with their treasures.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'As you expected, only when on the cusp of death will this group of hereditary slicks shows their true face and attitude.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'All the aristocrats who stayed to help trust you, Aston.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: '..."Trust." It was all part of Amir\'s plan, to leave the "kids" and "merchants" behind.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Kids and merchants are similar in a way. Sincerity is a very rare quality, Aston.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: '"Every problem can be talked through." Kids believe in this, and so do merchants.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'You are always right.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "This is a show, but with genuine supporters. Sincerity begets sincerity. A merchant should have a keen perception. Sophia's a smart kid, she's been growing.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "She's mastered everything that she couldn't learn in this carriage.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'You and Sophia...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: "Pardon me, Amir, but you don't have to pay for your predecessor's mistake...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'It\'s not a "mistake." Aston, you should know what you can and cannot say.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: 'You were only favored by fate.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'The God of Fate never favors... Aston, so-called eternity does not exist.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Eternal Engine "Asslam", the Eternal Throne. APUS has no end.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'A slender hand gently drops a weight on the higher side of the tipping scale.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'As long as the world keeps turning, everything will eventually return to where it started.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "If one can't see the end, it's only because the road is under their feet.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "The real destination in Sophia's heart... will be her new starting point.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Time to deliver the goods. The false trade is completed. Time for the real one, Aston.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Let\'s welcome the real trader who came on behalf of Babylonia... Or "agent," as that Ascendant claimed to be.', 4: '2'}
